snippet: It has been a rough beginning for the Californians who thought they were going to lead the nation in the revolt against affirmative action.    Less than a month after voters endorsed Proposition 209, a ballot initiative to end preferences based on...
lead_paragraph: It has been a rough beginning for the Californians who thought they were going to lead the nation in the revolt against affirmative action. Less than a month after voters endorsed Proposition 209, a ballot initiative to end preferences based on race and sex in government-funded programs, a Federal judge blocked its enforcement until a suit against it is tried in the courts.
abstract: Federal judge blocks temporarily enforcement of California's Proposition 209, ballot initiative to end preferences based on race or sex in government-funded programs (S)
